title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Credits Introduction, solid state ionics vis-Ã -vis solid state electronics, Principles of ionic conduction in ordered and disordered solids. Theories and models of ionic conduction-phenomenological models, free volume theory, configurational entropy model, jump relaxation and ion hopping model, bond percolation model and effective medium theory. Superionic materials classification-Crystalline anionic and cationic conductors, mixed ionic and electronic conductors, structural factors responsible for high ionic conductivity. Ion transport in homogeneous and heterogeneous medium-Ion conducting glasses, ceramics, polymers and composites. Concepts and feasibility of ion conducting polymer nanocomposites and nanocrystalline ceramics. Material problems and processing terchniques. Physical techniques for analysis of ion conducting solids. Transport properties and Ion dynamics. Application potential of ion conducting solids in devices, Design, Fabrication and evaluation of solid state lithium batteries, supercapacitors (EDLC and redox), PEM Fuel cell, SOFC, Gas sensors and display devices. Thermodynamics and mass transport in solid sate batteries. Battery performance and electrode kinetics. Double layer and other polarization effects at solid /solid interface.
